column4: please help, must be someone here with definate answer to fix /etc/resolv.conf missing in kppp
you'll need to explain the problem, please.
did kppp ask you for any dns servers?
do you know your isp's dns servers?
how are you connected to the internet now?
so you're using linux to connect to a remote vista?
okay - glad we cleared that up.
now, what dns servers did it give you in vista?
auto will always 'automatically' give you dns servers. clearly you don't know how to check. please open a command prompt and type this:  ipconfig /all   it will tell you the dns servers.
do you want help or do you want to keep chasing your tail?
i have just explained to you the first step you need to take. if you are unwilling to work with anyone in here on this, then you are unwilling to connect via dialup using ubuntu.
then you and i have nothing further to talk about.
does this look like the linux mint support channel?
have you tried making a usb startup disk?
do you have any important data residing on your ubuntu install?

your best bet, if you can, is to reinstall and try again - if you have a thumbdrive, you can make a usb startup disk with the System->Administration menu in order to help bail you out of this type of situation - if you have any files yet to be backed up, you should be able to get them out of your ~/Desktop or wherever they are onto a thumbdrive
please keep the chatter to the channel, it will make it easier for others to help you
that's why i asked if you had any important files on your system (email, documents, pictures, movies, etc) because the best way to fix it is to reinstall
